We have a bit of extra checking around this in order to provide descriptive messages when something goes wrong, but this method is essentially just:
If there are many to many fields present on the instance then they cannot be set until the model is instantiated, in which case the implementation is like so:

block_quote.paragraph: example_relationship = validated_data.pop(â€˜example_relationshipâ€™) instance = ExampleModel.objects.create(**validated_data) instance.example_relationship = example_relationship return instance

desc_content.paragraph: The default implementation also does not handle nested relationships. If you want to support writable nested relationships youâ€™ll need to write an explicit .create() method.

Bases: APIView
A view for retrieving course live iFrame.
Path: api/course_live/iframe/{course_id}/
Accepts: [GET]

list_item.paragraph: 200: OK - Contains a course live zoom iframe.
401: The requesting user is not authenticated.
403: The requesting user lacks access to the course.
404: The requested course does not exist.

block_quote.paragraph: In the case of a 200 response code, the response will be iframe HTML.

definition.paragraph: id=â€™lti-tab-embedâ€™ style=â€™width: 100%; min-height: 800px; border: noneâ€™ srcdoc=â€™{srcdoc}â€™ >

desc_content.paragraph: Handle HTTP/GET requests
Bases: APIView
Read only view that lists details of LIVE providers available for a course.
A view for retrieving Program live IFrame .
Path: api/course_live/providers/{course_id}/
Accepts: [GET]

list_item.paragraph: 200: Returns list of providers with active provider,
403: The requester cannot access the specified course.
404: The requested course does not exist.

block_quote.paragraph: In the case of a 200 response code, the response will be available live providers.

desc_content.paragraph: Get provider data for specified course :param course_id: course key string :type course_id: str
